alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 10:11AM EDT until May 04 at 9:43PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Richland and Lexington Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Saluda and Newberry Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Union and Newberry Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. At 124.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility with some access roads flooded. Extensive farmland flooding occurs in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 118.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EDT Saturday was 118.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 123.0 feet Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EDT.
